label: 鄭舜功
本: The Cambridge History of Japan, Volume 4:  Early Modern Japan . Cambridge University Press . 1991
説明文: [Author of Jih-pen i-chien (A mirror of Japan, c. 1564).  He] had gone to Japan in ...[the] year of 1556 as an official envoy charged with gathering intelligence on the wakō and enlisting the aid of the daimyo of Bungo, Ōtomo Sōrin, in their suppression.  Chen's Mirror" reflects the observations of a half-year's stay in the country (p. 254).  [日本一鑑、倭寇、豊後、大友宗麟]"
